File Manager Module

File system operations handler for pyAdmin package.

class pyAdmin.file_manager.FileManager[source]

Bases: object

Manage file system operations with path resolution and error handling.

Provides methods for: - Copying/moving files with automatic directory creation - Creating ZIP archives - Retrieving file metadata - Path resolution relative to caller’s directory

caller_dir

The directory of the script that instantiated the FileManager.

Type:

Path

compress_files(files: List[str], zip_name: str) → bool[source]

Create ZIP archive with validation of source files.

Skips non-file entries and directories. Prints detailed operation status.

Parameters:

  • files – List of relative file paths to compress

  • zip_name – Name for output ZIP archive (relative path)

Returns:

True if archive created successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> fm.compress_files(["data.csv", "config.yml"], "backup.zip")
Archive backup.zip created with 2 files
True

>>> fm.compress_files(["missing.txt"], "empty.zip")
Skipping /project/missing.txt: Not a file
Archive empty.zip created with 0 files
False
copy_file(source: str, destination: str) → bool[source]

Copy file with full path resolution and error handling.

Automatically creates destination directories if needed. Prints operation status and errors.

Parameters:

  • source – Relative path to source file

  • destination – Relative destination path

Returns:

True if copy succeeded, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> fm.copy_file("config.yml", "backups/config_backup.yml")
File /project/config.yml copied to /project/backups/config_backup.yml
True

>>> fm.copy_file("missing.txt", "backup.txt")
Copy failed: /project/missing.txt not found
False
get_file_metadata(file_path: str) → Dict[str, str | None][source]

Retrieve detailed metadata for specified file.

Parameters:

file_path – Relative path to target file

Returns:

Metadata dictionary with keys:

  • size_bytes: File size in bytes

  • creation_time: Creation date (DD.MM.YYYY)

  • modification_time: Last modified date (DD.MM.YYYY)

  • extension: File extension

  • permissions: Octal permissions string

  • absolute_path: Full path string

Returns empty dict if file not found

Return type:

Dict

Example

>>> fm.get_file_metadata("readme.md")
{
    'size_bytes': 2048,
    'creation_time': '15.07.2023',
    ...
}

>>> fm.get_file_metadata("missing.file")
File missing.file not found
{}
move_file(source: str, destination: str) → bool[source]

Move file with automatic directory creation.

Automatically creates destination directories if needed. Prints operation status and errors.

Parameters:

  • source – Relative path to source file

  • destination – Relative destination path

Returns:

True if move succeeded, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Example

>>> fm.move_file("temp.log", "logs/2023.log")
File temp.log moved to logs/2023.log
True

>>> fm.move_file("locked.file", "new.file")
Move failed: Permission denied for /project/locked.file
False
